title: parent root does not match the latest block header signing root in state
body:
Running on Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS

Possibly after restart of consensus beacon, it now fails to sync with mainnet -

```
Latest Prysm version is v3.2.1. ng root in state 0xa9f27972562d35accfbff1970bdb2126997ac0835c04d3fd3d8916ea746b2121
```

Error:
```
beacon node doesn't have a parent in db with root: 0x3ed2e473db0005b39c3e5116594bd23788b262008380bc50afea4bfae95f2627 (in processBatchedBlocks, slot=5805953)
```

Keeping it up for a few hours, it's seems to be repeating itself -

@ko0f If you fall back to v3.2.0 , does it work again ?

Same thing occurs. 

Is there a way to rollback into, let's say 5800000/5839577, where blocks are valid, instead of resyncing the whole thing?
